Class RepresentationCanvas

                    +--javax.swing.JPanel

                          +--be.ac.kuleuven.cs.ips2.project2002.awtgui.RepresentationCanvas
All Implemented Interfaces:
javax.accessibility.Accessible, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable
public class RepresentationCanvas
extends javax.swing.JPanel

Instances of this class represent connected logic circuits.

The intended use follows 3 steps:

  • add the logic circuits to be represented
  • close this instance; now the representations of the inputs connecting the adding logic circuits are created
  • add this instance to an awt frame, pack and display it

Changes to the configuration of logic circuits after the instance of this class is closed are not taken into account, and will probably result in disaster.

Note: this class is only partially structured and formally specified.

Version:
$Revision$
Author:
Jan Dockx

Method Detail

getMinimumSize

public java.awt.Dimension getMinimumSize()
This method returns the minimum size of this awt.Canvas. This is needed to have the Canvas display meaningfully in an awt.Frame with most LayoutManagers.
Overrides:
getMinimumSize in class javax.swing.JComponent

getPreferredSize

public java.awt.Dimension getPreferredSize()
This method returns the preferred size of this awt.Canvas. This is needed to have the Canvas display meaningfully in an awt.Frame with some LayoutManagers.
Overrides:
getPreferredSize in class javax.swing.JComponent

paintComponent

public void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
Paint this on the Graphics context given as argument. This method first asks the representation of inputs to paint themselves, connecting gates to the logic circuits they depend on (i.e., use as input). Then the logic circuits themselves are asked to paint themselves.
Overrides:
paintComponent in class javax.swing.JComponent

getLogicCircuitReprs

java.util.Set getLogicCircuitReprs()

add

public void add(LogicCircuit lc,
                java.awt.Dimension position)
         throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
Add a logic circuit to this representation to be represented on this Canvas, on the position given as argument. A representation for the circuit is generated, which will keep itself in sync with changes in the circuit.

close

public void close()
Close this representation. It is now ready to be shown in a frame. No new gates can be added anymore. This call generates representations for the inputs connecting the added logic circuits.

getLogicCircuitReprOf

LogicCircuitRepr getLogicCircuitReprOf(LogicCircuit lc)
Search for the logic circuit representation created for lc by this. Return null if you can't find one.
